Rollover Window

Summary
Rollover Window
MQA.RolloverWindowConstructs a MQRolloverWindow object.
Functions
hideHides the rollover if it is currently visible .
showMakes the rollover visible if it is currently hidden.
isHiddenReturns true if the info window is hidden.
getPointLLReturns the geographical point at which the rollover is anchored.
getPointXYReturns the screen coordinates at which the rollover is anchored.
getPixelOffsetReturns the offset, in pixels, of the tip of the rollover from the point on the map at whose geographical coordinates the rollover is anchored.
setRolloverGraphicFunction to set the rollover background to user defined color
getRolloverGraphicReturns the rollover background url for the specified orientation
setDefaultRolloverSets the rollover background to default color
setFlipStateEnabledEnables the flipping of rollover window.
getFlipStateEnabledReturns the status of the flipStateEnabled flag.
setTextLengthSets the number of characters to be displayed on the rollover window if the text length exeeds the rollover window boundary.
getTextLengthRetuns the textlength set by the user if any or default value will be returned.
setLeftRolloverOffsetXSets the x offset for the left rollover window.
getLeftRolloverOffsetXReturns the x offset for the left rollover.
setRightRolloverOffsetXSets the x offset for the right rollover window.
getRightRolloverOffsetXReturns the x offset for the right rollover.
setRolloverOffsetYSets the y offset for the rollover window
getRolloverOffsetYReturns the y offset for the rollover window

MQA.RolloverWindow

Constructs a MQRolloverWindow object.  MQA.RolloverWindow provides rollover popup windows for MQA.Poi objects.

Parameters

map(MQA.TileMap) The map this object will be contained by.

Note

The MQA.RolloverWindow is created automatically with a map.  It does not need to be instantiated manually.

isHidden

Parameters

none

getPointLL

Returns the geographical point at which the rollover is anchored.  The tip of the window points to this point on the map, modulo the pixel offset.

Parameters

none

Returns

MQA.LatLng

See Also

getPointXY

getPointXY

Returns the screen coordinates at which the rollover is anchored.  The tip of the window points to this point on the map.

Parameters

none

Returns

MQA.Point

See Also

getPointLL

getPixelOffset

Returns the offset, in pixels, of the tip of the rollover from the point on the map at whose geographical coordinates the rollover is anchored.

Parameters

none

Returns

<MQA.Offset>

setRolloverGraphic

Function to set the rollover background to user defined color

Parameters

leftImgSrc(string) New background image url when popup opens towards right
rightImgSrc(string) New background image url when popup opens towards left

Returns

n/a

See Also

getRolloverGraphic, setDefaultRollover

Note

If no params are passed, the default image is used for both.  If just one param is passed, only left image is changed.

getRolloverGraphic

Returns the rollover background url for the specified orientation

Parameters

orientation(string) “left” or “right”.  If no parameters is specified, the left image is returned.

Returns

string

See Also

setRolloverGraphic, setDefaultRollover

setDefaultRollover

Sets the rollover background to default color

Parameters

none

Returns

n/a

See Also

setRolloverGraphic, getRolloverGraphic

setFlipStateEnabled

Enables the flipping of rollover window.  When enabled, rollover window will flip its state and open towards left if the normal rollover window crosses the map boundary.

Parameters

enabled(boolean) flag to enable/disable flipping of rollover window

Returns

n/a

See Also

getFlipStateEnabled

getFlipStateEnabled

Returns the status of the flipStateEnabled flag.

Parameters

none

Returns

boolean

See Also

setFlipStateEnabled

setTextLength

Sets the number of characters to be displayed on the rollover window if the text length exeeds the rollover window boundary.  Default value is 31 characters.

Parameters

length(int) number of characters that needs to be visible on rollover popup.

Returns

n/a

See Also

getTextLength

getTextLength

Retuns the textlength set by the user if any or default value will be returned.

Parameters

none

Returns

int

See Also

setTextLength

setLeftRolloverOffsetX

Sets the x offset for the left rollover window.

Parameters

offsetWidth(int) number of pixels to x offset the rollover.

Returns

n/a

See Also

getLeftRolloverOffsetX, setRightRolloverOffsetX, getRightRolloverOffsetX

getLeftRolloverOffsetX

Returns the x offset for the left rollover.

Parameters

none

Returns

int
